title: Nick Jonas groped by fan on stage during Jonas Brothers concert
text:
Nick kept performing despite the incident. (Picture: Getty Images)

Nick Jonas was groped by a fan at a recent Jonas Brothers concert, as he can be seen asking her to stop.

The Cool singer is seen performing alongside Joe and Kevin in a video shared on Twitter, as the audience-member touches his leg and bum.

At one point, he appears to turn around and ask her to stop.

A security guard for Priyanka Chopra’s husband is also seen intervening in the 18-second video.

The incident reportedly took place during the band’s gig last week at the Hollywood Bowl, part of their Happiness Begins tour.

He has yet to respond to the video.

WTF😠🤬 this is very disrespectful!! pic.twitter.com/he2KGmm2qS — Nick Jonas FAN 🍭🆒 (@NickJDaily) October 22, 2019

Fans were appalled by the clip, with one fuming: ‘This is just crossing the line’.

Another said: ‘This is honestly so hard to watch. Can they not get it through their heads that Nick is clearly uncomfortable as he turns back to look at them and tried to swat their hand away?

Advertisement

‘Ugh, this is not how you should treat them.

‘They’re people just like us who don’t need to feel violated.’

The guys are currently on their Happiness Begins tour (Picture: Getty Images North America)

The incident comes after Nick was revealed as a coach on the next season of The Voice in the US.

Meredith Ahr, president of the alternative and reality group at NBC Entertainment confirmed the news, stating: ‘As a member of one of the hottest pop groups, Nick’s success in navigating all aspects of the music industry is exceptional.

Nick is joining the US version of The Voice as a coach. (Picture: Getty Images for Philymack)

‘We were so impressed by his innate musicality, technical aptitude and passion that he brought to Songland earlier this year and know he will be an incredible fit as a coach on The Voice.

‘We are excited to see Nick lend his mentorship, relatability and breadth of knowledge to a new crop of artists.’

A rep for Nick has been contacted for Metro.co.uk.
